title: Breakfast in Sacramento
name: Breakfast in Sacramento
description:
A Map by Gpwieland

These are some places to eat breakfast in Sacramento

properties.name: 33rd Street Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 3301 Folsom Blvd, Sacramento, CA33rd Street Bistro is a pretty hip eatery around here, and they do a very good job at pacific type food for lunch and dinner. Breakfast is pretty good too, but isn\'t as good as their other offerings. The potatoes were cold too. Still the rest was pretty good.

properties.name: Cornerstone
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 2330 J St, Sacramento, 95816Cornerstone is a very popular place with the weekend breakfast crowd. They have greatly expanded over the years, so getting a seat now isn\'t nearly as hard as it once was. There may still be a wait from time to time though. The potato platter is the number one choice here, but bring an appetite.

properties.name: Crepeville
properties.description: Posted by GpwielandCrepeville is one of several newish crepe places in Sacramento. It is counter service, which I hate, but still. The crepes are ok, and the choices are plentiful. We got it for take out, and it was alright but not stellar. There are several locations around Sacramento.

properties.name: Dad's
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 1310 S Street, Sacramento, CA 95814A wide variety of delicious sandwiches, including a good breakfast selection. Counter service sandwich shop

properties.name: Dragonfly
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 1809 Capitol Ave SacramentoThis is the first time I had been to Dragonfly. It is part of the Zocalo pair of trajically hip place that went in on the corner of 17th and capital around the same time. It is apparently some type of japanese fusion style place with many sushi offerings and such. For breakfast they seem terribly vacant, but the food was actually quite good, and not too badly priced. The others in my group inexplicably ordered soutwest style breakfasts, but I had an omelet with stir fried vegetables and shrimp, a side of fried rice and chinese sausage. It was great, and an interesting take on a traditional breakfast.

properties.name: Ernesto's
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 1901 16th St, Sacramento, 95814Ernesto\'s is pretty good traditional style mexican food. Their Breakfast is only ok, but not too bad. A good spot to stop for a mexican breakfast. The service is fast and friendly. Much less crowded than in the evenings.

properties.name: Fox and Goose
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 1001 R St, Sacramento, CAThis si a very British style public house, so you can go ahead and grab a Guinness with your breakfast, as I frequently do. There are many good things about breakfast here, but my favorite is still the New Yorker omelet. It has smoked salmon, onion, and cream cheese. really good. The scones are also worth while.

properties.name: Gonul's J Street Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland  3839 J Street Sacramento CA 95816We went in for Easter Brunch for the first time, but they apparently serve brunch on Saturday and Sunday. This is in the Location that was Artie\'s. THe new decor is very much like a typical Euro bistro typle place. The food was a little pricey for breakfast fare, but was really good. I will certainly be back to try breakfast on a regular day. I had a bacon, zucchini, and blue cheese omelet and the wife had strawberry and ricotta blintzes

properties.name: Jalapeños
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 1413 21st Street Sacramento Jalapenos is a little hole in the wall, but does offer a little outside seating. I just got my food to go, as I walked by. It is counter service, but you make up a lot in price. The food was pretty good too, though I wouldn\'t go crazy about it. I had breakfast tacos and a veggie breakfast burrito. They also had Orange Crush in glass bottles, so I couldn\'t pass that up.

properties.name: Lucky Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland  1111 21st St, Sacramento, CAThis used to be a pretty good spot , but the last coupld of times I have been there the service has been really terrible. like forty-five minutes just to take the order. I may check back in a while, but it is not among my first choices.

properties.name: Pancake Circus
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland  2101 Broadway, Sacramento, CAThe Pancake Circus used to be one of my favorite places to go for breakfast. It was always cheap, and the food was ordinary, but good and reliable. That hasn\'t been the case on my last few trips there. I have been avoiding it for a while, but I\'ll probably give it a shot in the next few months.

properties.name: Rice Bowl
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 2378 Florin Rd, Sacramento, CAThe Rice Bowl is the top place to get dim sum in town. I think that New Canton on Broadway is better, but the total number of people going there pales next to Rice Bowl. The place is huge, and frequently full, so don\'t be too surprised if you have to wait a little. Well worth it though. Be adventurous. Take one of each.

properties.name: Sweetwater
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 5641 J St, Sacramento, CAThis is on the former site of the original Shakey\'s Pizza. Sadly the original funky decor is all gone and replaced with your standard trendy kind of style. Sunday brunch offers several tasty selections, though the menu is more limited than I\'d like to see. The Sonoma scramble was very tasty, but the potatoes were a little on the not-crispy side. Not bad.

properties.name: The Sub Shack
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 5201 Folsom Blvd Sacramento, CA 95819Though the Sub Shack is primarily a place to get excellent sandwiches, on the weekend they serve up what is one of the best breakfasts in town. There is a daily special, and the Guinness corned beef hash is great.

properties.name: Tower Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland  1518 Broadway, Sacramento, CAThe outside seating is a big draw here, and the ambiance is quite nice. THe thing that really keeps me, and others, coming back is the frnch toast. Not to be missed. Even if you get something else, try splitting a half order of the french toast. It\'s like eating hot, bready ice cream.

properties.name: Tres Hermanas
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 2416 K St, SacramentoTres Hermanas is always solid, but I think that there are better Mexican places for breakfast. Zocalo comes to mind. I had the Huevos Pancho Villa, and think that is was a little too cluttered, so no taste stood out in particular. It is my own fault, because the description said it was. The chicken mole is really good, but not really breakfast food.

properties.name: Vallejo's
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 1900 4th St Sacramento CaAnybody who has been to Vallejo\'s for lunch or dinner will have a good idea about the breakfast there. Nothing groundbreaking, but good quality solid Mexican breakfast fare. The prices are right and the portions large. The staff is friendly and quick.

properties.name: Zen Toro
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 900 15th St Sacramento The front door may say closed, but go to the side door on Saturdays between eight and eleven for breakfast. I was trying to get to this place for some time, and I\'m glad I did. This is a sushi place by night, but the breakfast is special. In addition to several standard choices, there are a number Japanese and Hawaiian choices. I had the Spam Heaven, and it was as advertised. Spam sushi style, and a broth soup with spam and sweetend cooked eggs and noodles. I also had a side of Japanese toast, which was huge. The coffee was very good. Priced right around seven dollars for a meal. I\'ll be back to try the other interesting offerings.

properties.name: Zocalo
properties.description: Posted by Gpwieland 1801 Capitol Ave, Sacramento, 95814Zocalo is a high end mexican place, and I noticed they were open for brunch on Sundays. I wasn\'t expecting all that much, other than over-pricing, but I was pleasantly surprised. The food was really excellent, and the price, while on the high side, was not too hard to handle. the whole menu is available for brunch, and mexican pastries are served along with chips and salsa. I can\'t think of anything bad to say about breakfast here. Sunday only starting at 9 am.

properties.name: cafe bernardo
properties.description: Posted by Robbo 2726 Capitol Ave, Sacramento, CA, 95816Kick ass breafast fodder in Midtown Sacramento
